entries.gotowork: I don't have time to chat anymore.
entries.next: You're pretty handy to have around. Come and visit me from time to time, maybe I can find you more work later.
entries.npc_smuggle_4: Hoo yeh! Gimme the dat, I know what it's at. I do my magic, and -- Yee-eah! Seems Binna's old man is alive. Some kind of distant signal from Wild Space. Bad engine and low fuel, but he's flying home!
entries.npc_smuggle_3: Is this for me? From Binna? She's the nicest lady in the galaxy. Excuse me, I just put the baby to bed and I reeeally need some sleep.
entries.npc_smuggle_2: I don' need no stimpack! I ain't hardly hit. Can't take me out that easy -- easy -- hol' on, lemme get my breath back -- wuzzat? Stimpack? Whyn't you say so, junior? Give it over. What? What? Sorry, don' hear so good nowadays.
entries.npc_smuggle_1: Unfortunately, the family got called away when one child had to go into the bacta tanks. Thank you anyway. I'll take the toy to the children.
entries.player_sorry_4: I'm not sure yet.  Your slicer friend is -uh-  still working on it.
entries.player_reset_4: This is too emotional for me.  I can't handle it anymore.  Get someone else to do this.
entries.player_2_4: Sorry, I can't so this.  I think you should do it yourself, Binna.
entries.player_1_4: Absolutely.  This is the least I can do for you.
entries.npc_reward_4: That -- that's -- oh. All right, time for an old lady to sit down. He's really -- Okay. I'm all right now. Thank you. Here, take this, it's tasty. I think I want to be alone now. Alone with my dreams.
entries.npc_reset_4: No problem, friend. Have a drink, kick back, calm down and relax.
entries.npc_breech_4: Wee hoo!  Are you the one that Binna say is coming to me?  Hoo yehaa!
entries.npc_backtowork_4: I've been waiting all these years, I don't think a little more will hurt.  Let me know when he's found something.
entries.npc_4_4: He was piloting a cargo freighter on the Corellia Route. Ran into pirates and had to make a wild jump through hyperspace. It's been years, but I never gave up hope. I've stayed in this dive ever since, just on the chance he'd make it back here. If I left, he'd never find me.
entries.npc_3_4: No problem, friend. Have a drink, kick back, relax.
entries.npc_2_4: Thanks. Fella named Dinnis the Blade. Nice enough guy, a little wild. Don't stand too close to him, he doesn't believe in using water.
entries.npc_1_4: I got this datadisk from a friend on Corellia. May say something about  my husband. He went missing years back. A friend who looked for him sent this report, but the data got corrupted. Can you take it to a data slicer friend of mine?
entries.dontknowyou_4: Ha hooey!  You not the one.  Ho yahaa!  I don't have things to say to you now.  Habba hodie!
entries.dontknowyou_3: Well, you have yourself a good day, you hear?  And don't get caught when the wind starts to blow.
entries.dontknowyou_2: Huh?  I thought you were one of them droids.  Ah, nevermind.
entries.player_sorry_3: Oh, I haven't given it to her yet.  There was a sandstorm and I didn't want it to get dirty.
entries.player_sorry_2: I'm not too sure how to speak to a Clone Wars vet.  I don't want to treat him with less respect than he deserves.
entries.player_reset_3: I don't think I'm suited to giving shirts to new mothers.  I'm sorry, but I can't do this anymore.
entries.player_reset_2: I just found out my mother is in the Hospital.  I need to go to her.  Could you have someone else deliver the stimpack?
entries.npc_reset_3: Not a problem. We'll take care of this somehow. Sit down, relax.
entries.npc_reset_2: That's okay. You just sit back and get comfortable now.
entries.npc_backtowork_3: That's mighty considerate of you.  I trust you'll get it to her safely.
entries.npc_backtowork_2: Oh, that's not a problem.  He doesn't put on airs about it.  Just greet him like you would any other person.
entries.npc_breech_3: How are you doing today?  It's looking like we might be in for a bit of a sandstorm, don't you think?
entries.npc_breech_2: You there!  You aren't one of them Confederation guys, are you?  The war is over, so put down your weapons.  Eh?  What was that?
entries.npc_work_3: So, how did she like the shirt?
entries.npc_work_2: You're back quick.  Did you forget something?
entries.npc_work_1: Didn't expect to see you back so soon.  Were you able to deliver the toy to the kids?
entries.dontknowyou_1: Oh, nevermind.  I thought you were a friend of Binna.  Well, be careful out there!
entries.cantwork: Hello there. It's good to see busy folks taking time out from the whirl at Cheapside Cantina. Glad to have you.
entries.npc_reset_1: That's all right. I'll find someone who has the time. Thanks anyway.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: It's really appreciated.  Make sure that you get to see the children's faces when you give it to them.  I want to hear all about it.
entries.player_sorry_1: Sorry, I had something come up.  I'm off to deliver it right now.
entries.player_reset_1: I've been told that my friends need urgent help.  I can no longer deliver this toy.  Here.
entries.player_3_2: Why did someone shoot at Gen Horosi?
entries.player_2_3: I'm a bit busy right now.  I'm sorry, but I can't do that for you.
entries.player_2_2: Sorry, but I'm not interested in helping you with this.
entries.player_1_3: Sounds simple enough.  Sure, I'll do it.
entries.player_1_2: For a Clone Wars veteran, I'll do anything!  Sure!
entries.player_1_1: I'll do that for the little kids, yes.
entries.npc_reward_3: Thanks. Here, friend, have a drink on the house. Don't drink it too fast, or your eyes will cross.
entries.npc_reward_2: That was real nice of you. Gen'll be okay. He's been through more than any squadron of stormtroopers. Here, I made this for you. Tasty.
entries.npc_reward_1: Mighty nice of you. Those kids have already been through stuff -- well, it's a tough life in Bestine, sometimes. Here, take a little something as a reward.
entries.npc_4_3: The shirt is warm? Oh yeah, I guess that's because I just took it off. Will you deliver it to Peele?
entries.npc_4_2: Aw, nobody was gunning for him specifically. It was just some wild-eyed glitterstim druggie on a jaunt, blasting things and giggling. Happens too much around Cheapside. Can you help Gen?
entries.npc_4_1: doesn't really -- It's a little fuel drum I cleaned up. Tried to decorate it with little drawings -- aww, it's just to beat on, makes noise. It's about all we can manage in Cheapside. What do you say to the delivery job?
entries.npc_3_3: Not a problem. We'll take care of this somehow. Sit down, relax.
entries.npc_3_2: That's okay. You just sit back and get comfortable now.
entries.npc_3_1: That's all right. I'll find someone who has the time. Thanks anyway.
entries.npc_2_3: Great. Come on back and I'll give you a drink on the house.
entries.npc_2_2: Thanks. You might not find Gen at home. Sometimes wanders out of town and has to be led back. Feisty old guy, but a good heart. Oh, don't mention the Emperor, okay? It just gets him riled.
entries.npc_2_1: Real kind of you. Here's the toy, such as it is. You got the coordinates? Good.
entries.npc_1_3: Friend of mine, Peele Noonal, just had her first child and -- oh, thanks, I'll pass along your kind words -- and her nurse wrapped the baby in Peele's shirt. Ever had a baby? Trust me, it does the shirt no good. I want you to take this shirt of mine to Peele as a maternity gift.
entries.npc_1_2: Some sleemo took a pot-shot at my favorite old guy, Gen Horosi. He's a Clone Wars veteran, incredibly ancient but still sharp. I got some friends to help him get home, but he needs healing. I scraped together some credits and got a stimpack. Can you deliver it?
entries.npc_1_1: Stormtroopers attacked a Rebel base near here. Their fire went astray, as usual. They almost killed an innocent civilian family. I sent these folks to stay with a fellow I know, but they're still very shaken. There's not much I can do, but I do have a toy for the kids. Can you deliver it?
